newsitem.title: MAURITIUS: Mauritius rupee weaker on dollar, firms on pound.
newsitem.headline: Mauritius rupee weaker on dollar, firms on pound.

text.p: The Mauritian rupee weakened against the dollar but firmed versus the pound on Monday, forex dealers said.
The rupee was fixed at a mean commercial rate of 19.916 for one dollar from 19.866 last Friday. Against the pound, the rupee traded at a mean rate of 33.5035 from 33.7220 last Friday.
Forex dealers said although commercial banks were long in their foreign exchange positions, the softer rupee on Monday reflected the strengthening dollar in international markets.
"If banks were not long, that is there was not such an oversupply of foreign currencies, the rupee would have depreciated by a greater amount against the dollar today," one dealer told Reuters.

The dealer added that hard currency demand from importers was still relatively low but there was a good level of supply from the Indian Ocean island's textiles export and tourism sectors at this period of year.
Further hard currency supply to commercial banks also took place last Friday with a Mauritius Sugar Syndicate tender sale of pound obtained from Mauritius' sugar exports.
Sugar and textiles exports and tourism are the leading hard currency earners of Mauritius.
